title: Why does Nasus get nerfed for his sustain yet the new Keystone is allowed to exist?
body:
Champions like {{champion:23}} and {{champion:157}} are even more stupid to lane against since they get infinite free sustain with the new keystone since they get massive amounts of crit from their passives. 

The mastery in question is obviously Warlord's Bloodlust.
Critical strikes heal for 15% of the damage dealt and grant you 20% attack speed for 4 seconds (2 second cooldown).

First of all, almost every single other keystone requires the target to be a champion yet this one allows you infinite free sustain from minions which is a pain to deal with in lane (and monsters for jungling infinite sustain), especially when dealing with champions like Trynd and Yasuo, who are already oppressive in lane. And then on top of that it gives free attack speed which lasts longer than the cooldown. 

Also this mastery scales incredibly well into the late game again ESPECIALLY on trynd and yasuo but also on ADCs so its not like its just an early game lane sustain thing, it just scales even harder late making them incredibly difficult to kill and increasing their DPS by a lot. 

It's bad enough with the AP item nerfs (especially to Zhonya, which could be used to counter these AD champs) and the increased crit from items but they have to add this now? Like really. Way over the top. This mastery is WAY too strong.

No,her passive no longer counts as a crit.

>P - Frost Shot
Base slow reduced 5/11/17/23/29/35% >>> 5/9/13/17/21/25%
Dealing bonus damage via Frost Shot no longer counts as a Critical Strike (bonus damage unchanged)
Ashe’s Critical Strikes (which once again happen only by chance per all other characters) deal only 1.0 Total AD (as opposed to 2.0 standard), but they apply Frost Shot’s slow at double effectiveness (10/18/26/34/42/50%), decaying to the base amount over the duration of the slow.

You can read the original post [here](http://boards.pbe.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/champions-gameplay-feedback/N7VZrAws-smaller-522-marksmen-changes-pbe-feedback-thread).

So if i get this right: She still does exactly the same damage she is doing now, but now also gets a extra slow when she "really" crits? That's kind of strong especially if you think about that 50% slow every 2-3 Attacks...
Ashe can now crit again. Her passive is just an auto-attack enhancer. Her crits no longer deal bonus damage, but apply a strong slow.

The 2 second CD makes it pretty underwhelming in the late game, so I wouldn't worry about it at that point. Attack Speed makes the 15% lifesteal from the mastery become increasingly inefficient, as more attacks mean that less of them get the bonus. You're much better off building any lifesteal item than relying on the mastery.

Also, mid is when it's arguably the strongest since attack speeds are lower, but then so are crit chances. Really, only Tryn and Yas can make full use of it, though more so at different points in the game. The mastery is fine, but the two aforementioned outliers might present an issue.
Its not just he LS, its the 4s 20% increase in Attack speed that you can consistently have up.
That's actually a good point and I kind of forget about that particular effect on the mastery. Still, I find it amusing that one effect makes the other one less efficient

I'm gunna assume its been said before, but the changes to ADCs are a small part of a larger rework. The game is going to function terribly due to other roles becoming outdated and having their only dynamics brutally eviscerated by newer, stronger, more overloaded champions. Its at the stage where they are going to have to bring everyone up to match the current set of reworks, and as a result, huge masses of champions are going to be utterly useless until their queue time is up. Its basically going to feel like the assassin meta felt to immobile, peel reliant mains; utterly toxic. Give it time, a break from the game is what I'm doing till this shitstorm blows over.
